content:
DataGridViewCellCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of cells in a DataGridViewRow.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.ListBindable(false)]
public class DataGridViewCellCollection : System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection, System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
Object
MarshalByRefObject
System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection
DataGridViewCellCollection

Inherited Members

CreateObjRef(Type)
GetLifetimeService()
InitializeLifetimeService()
MemberwiseClone(Boolean)
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)

GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()
CopyTo(Array,Int32)
Count
GetEnumerator()
IsReadOnly
IsSynchronized
SyncRoot

Remarks

DataGridViewCellCollection objects are retrieved by the Cells property.

Constructors

DataGridViewCellCollection(DataGridViewRow)

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewCellCollection class.

public DataGridViewCellCollection (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow dataGridViewRow);
dataGridViewRow
DataGridViewRow

The DataGridViewRow that owns the collection.

Properties

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the cell at the provided index location. In C#, this property is the indexer for the DataGridViewCellCollection class.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell this[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the cell to get or set.

Value
DataGridViewCell

The DataGridViewCell stored at the given index.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The specified value when setting this property is null.

InvalidOperationException

The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a DataGridView control.

-or-

The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a DataGridViewRow.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than 0.

-or-

index is equal to or greater than the number of cells in the collection.

Item(String)

Gets or sets the cell in the column with the provided name. In C#, this property is the indexer for the DataGridViewCellCollection class.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell this[string columnName] { get; set; }
columnName
String

The name of the column in which to get or set the cell.

Value
DataGridViewCell

The DataGridViewCell stored in the column with the given name.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

columnName does not match the name of any columns in the control.

ArgumentNullException

The specified value when setting this property is null.

InvalidOperationException

The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a DataGridView control.

-or-

The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a DataGridViewRow.

List

Gets an ArrayList containing DataGridViewCellCollection objects.

protected override System.Collections.ArrayList List { get; }
Value
ArrayList

ArrayList.

Methods

Add(DataGridViewCell)

Adds a cell to the collection.

public virtual int Add (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell dataGridViewCell);
dataGridViewCell
DataGridViewCell

A DataGridViewCell to add to the collection.

Returns
Int32

The position in which to insert the new element.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The row that owns this DataGridViewCellCollection already belongs to a DataGridView control.

-or-

dataGridViewCell already belongs to a DataGridViewRow.

Remarks

Use this method to populate a DataGridViewRow with cells before you add the row to a DataGridView control. Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.

AddRange(DataGridViewCell[])

Adds an array of cells to the collection.

public virtual void AddRange (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell[] dataGridViewCells);
dataGridViewCells
DataGridViewCell[]

The array of DataGridViewCell objects to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

dataGridViewCells is null.

InvalidOperationException

The row that owns this DataGridViewCellCollection already belongs to a DataGridView control.

-or-

At least one value in dataGridViewCells is null.

-or-

At least one cell in dataGridViewCells already belongs to a DataGridViewRow.

-or-

At least two values in dataGridViewCells are references to the same DataGridViewCell.

Remarks

Use this method to populate a DataGridViewRow with cells before you add the row to a DataGridView control. Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.

Clear()

Clears all cells from the collection.

public virtual void Clear ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The row that owns this DataGridViewCellCollection already belongs to a DataGridView control.

Remarks

Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a DataGridView control. Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.

Contains(DataGridViewCell)

Determines whether the specified cell is contained in the collection.

public virtual bool Contains (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell dataGridViewCell);
dataGridViewCell
DataGridViewCell

A DataGridViewCell to locate in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if dataGridViewCell is in the collection; otherwise, false.

CopyTo(DataGridViewCell[],Int32)

Copies the entire collection of cells into an array at a specified location within the array.

public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell[] array, int index);
array
DataGridViewCell[]

The destination array to which the contents will be copied.

index
Int32

The index of the element in array at which to start copying.

IndexOf(DataGridViewCell)

Returns the index of the specified cell.

public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell dataGridViewCell);
dataGridViewCell
DataGridViewCell

The cell to locate in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The zero-based index of the value of dataGridViewCell parameter, if it is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.

Insert(Int32,DataGridViewCell)

Inserts a cell into the collection at the specified index.

public virtual void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell dataGridViewCell);
index
Int32

The zero-based index at which to place dataGridViewCell.

dataGridViewCell
DataGridViewCell

The DataGridViewCell to insert.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The row that owns this DataGridViewCellCollection already belongs to a DataGridView control.

-or-

dataGridViewCell already belongs to a DataGridViewRow.

Remarks

Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a DataGridView control. Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.

OnCollectionChanged(CollectionChangeEventArgs)

Raises the CollectionChanged event.

protected void OnCollectionChanged (System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs e);
e
CollectionChangeEventArgs

A CollectionChangeEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see NIB: Raising an Event.

The OnCollectionChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Remove(DataGridViewCell)

Removes the specified cell from the collection.

public virtual void Remove (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell cell);
cell
DataGridViewCell

The DataGridViewCell to remove from the collection.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The row that owns this DataGridViewCellCollection already belongs to a DataGridView control.

ArgumentException

cell could not be found in the collection.

Remarks

Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a DataGridView control. Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the cell at the specified index.

public virtual void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the DataGridViewCell to be removed.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The row that owns this DataGridViewCellCollection already belongs to a DataGridView control.

Remarks

Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a DataGridView control. Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.

Events

CollectionChanged

Occurs when the collection is changed.

public event System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventHandler CollectionChanged;

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.

void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero.

ArgumentException

array is multidimensional.

-or-

The number of elements in the DataGridViewCellCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.

InvalidCastException

The DataGridViewCellCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataGridViewCellCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

Gets the number of elements contained in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The number of elements in the DataGridViewCellCollection.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataGridViewCellCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).

Returns
Boolean

false in all cases.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataGridViewCellCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.
